content:
Digital tools can be super convenient and accessible.

For medication reminders, here are some highly-rated apps:

1. **Medisafe**: Medisafe is a popular medication reminder app that allows you to track your meds, set reminders, and receive notifications. It also has a dosage tracker, refill reminders, and a pill box feature. (4.8/5 stars on the App Store, 4.9/5 stars on Google Play)
2. **MyMedSchedule**: MyMedSchedule is a user-friendly app that lets you track your medications, set reminders, and view your schedule. It also has a medication list, dosage tracker, and refill reminders. (4.8/5 stars on the App Store, 4.7/5 stars on Google Play)
3. **Pillboxie**: Pillboxie is a simple and easy-to-use app that allows you to track your medications, set reminders, and view your schedule. It also has a pill box feature and customizable reminders. (4.7/5 stars on the App Store, 4.6/5 stars on Google Play)

For symptom tracking, here are some highly-rated apps:

1. **Sympto**: Sympto is a comprehensive symptom tracking app that allows you to track your symptoms, medications, and appointments. It also has a mood tracker, pain tracker, and customizable tracking features. (4.8/5 stars on the App Store, 4.7/5 stars on Google Play)
2. **CareZone**: CareZone is a health management app that allows you to track your medications, appointments, and symptoms. It also has a task list, notes feature, and customizable tracking features. (4.8/5 stars on the App Store, 4.7/5 stars on Google Play)
3. **MySymptoms**: MySymptoms is a simple and easy-to-use app that allows you to track your symptoms, including when they occur, how severe they are, and any factors that might trigger them. (4.7/5 stars on the App Store, 4.6/5 stars on Google Play)

All of these apps are available on both iOS and Android devices, and most of them offer a free version or trial period, so you can try them out before committing to a paid subscription.

Since you're already using a digital calendar, you can try integrating one of these apps into your existing system. You might find that using a single app for both medication reminders and symptom tracking works best for you, or you might prefer to use separate apps for each task.
